header.title: JEGrid - Enterprise Grid Computing for Java

section.title: Introduction
section.p: JEGrid is a light weight enterprise grid framework for Java that provides federation (clustering), coarse-grained parallelism, and load balancing. Using the coarse-grained parallelism features, super-computer performance can be realized with COTS (Commodity, Off The Shelf) hardware which is more economical, more scaleable, and more familiar to IT personell.

ul.li: SIMD distributed parallelism - Each task has code and any number of inputs. The code is run on multiple machines to process the input in parallel. JEGroups handles all the network communication and threading.
Fast, with a minimal API - JEGroups has very minimal network overhead for maximum speed. The simple API requires only a few lines of code to take advantage of parallelism.

Automatic clustering and failure detection - Servers, clients and observers automatically join the grid cluster. If any node fails all nodes depending on it will be notified and take appropriate action.
Flexible networking - Can use IP Multicast, UDP, or TCP as it's underlying protocol.
